args: Hey, Cleo! Teach me how to cook!
Aw, c'mon! I made soba for everyone\nbefore, remember?
Okay, yeah, I know that was terrible.

But I can get better! C'mon, don't let me
wander through life having everyone think
of me as the lady who almost accidentally
poisoned them.
Take all your cooking knowledge and\nskills and smush 'em into my brain!
Our first lesson will be a gratin.
I have no idea what that is, but OKAY!
First, thinly slice onions and potatoes.
Get ready for PAIN, onion! Hah! Hah!\nAAAAUGH MY EYES!\nI CAN'T SEEEEEE!
I asked you to thinly slice the onions.\nThose are chunks. GENEROUS chunks.
Yeah, so? They're way more fun to eat this\nway! Crunch for days!
Please slice them thinly. The pieces will\nnever cook all the way through otherwise.
Ooooooh! THAAAAAT'S why you do it!
Next, we will sauté the potatoes and\nonions until lightly browned.
Right. Lemme just crank the heat up to\neleven and throw those puppies in!
Those are not lightly browned, Botan.\nThose are burnt. They may actually be ash.
Yeah, I guess they are a bit crispy, huh?\nStill, that's better than being raw!
Well, perhaps a deft touch with\nseasonings will cover up the flavor.
Now then, turn off the heat,\nadd the flour and butter, and mix.\nHowever, you only need to use—
A bunch, right? That's a measurement.\nHAVE A BUNCH, GRATIN! HAH!
Botan! A bucket is NOT the preferred\nmethod for measuring out flour!\nYou must be exacting and precise.
Aw, c'mon! It's fine to eyeball it, yeah?
*sigh* I understand now why you are such\na terrible cook. You rely far too much\non approximation and...instinct.
The recipe is solid. If you follow it to the\nletter, the end result will be delicious.

Your failures are created by deviating
from the recipe whenever you decide
something ＂looks about right＂ or else
is ＂close enough.＂
Yeah, but it's a huge pain to measure\neverything out with all those teeny\nlittle spoon dealies. Who needs that?!
Recipes are all about mastering the basics\nof cooking. How can you improve if you\nrefuse to master the basics?
Then let us try again—FOLLOWING the\nrecipe this time.
And so, Cleo hammered home the importance of\nrecipes into Botan's mind. As a result...
*nibble* It tastes just like the recipe.\nBy which I mean it is delicious.
Yay! I'm not terrible at cooking anymore!
Surprisingly, you have an aptitude for it.\nSo as long as you follow the instructions,\nI think your dishes can be successful.
Speaking of which, there's something\nI want to talk to you about...
Er, is Botan making dinner tonight? *gulp*
Wipe that terrified look off your face,\nmister! I'm gonna restore my good name!
Oh man, I'm gonna end up talkin'\nabout this meal with a therapist...
No worries, chum! I'm a changed woman.
I taught her the basics. She will not fail\nif she follows my instructions.
I won't make the same mistake I did\nlast time. It's going to be GREAT!
In that case, I'm looking forward to it.
Then just sit back and wait for dinner!
Pssst! Cleo! Are ya SURE about this?\nShouldn't ya watch in case she mistakes\nthe sugar for cyanide or somethin'?
The only way she can restore her culinary\ngood name is by succeeding alone.
It's okay, Ranzal. Botan can do anything\nshe puts her mind to.
I still ain't sure about this, but let's go\ntrain so we can work up an appetite.
Hey, welcome back, guys!\nEr, so about dinner...
Hey, there's soup on the table—and it\nactually looks GOOD!
Let us eat before it gets cold.
Oh wow, this is GREAT! Now I'm really\nlooking forward to the next course.
Hey, wait a sec. Where IS the next course?
I taught you a great number of recipes,\nBotan. What happened?
Well, I made the soup first, and I was\nSUPER careful to follow the recipe\nright down to the last teaspoon.
I started cooking everything else and then\nconcentrated back on the soup, and uh...
Well, by the time the soup was done,\neverything else was kinda sorta...burnt.
I see. You were so focused on one thing\nthat you neglected everything else.
Ugh! I want to crawl into a hole and die!
You have a very analytical mind,\nwhich can sometimes cause a person\nto hone in on a single item.
Don't let it get you down. We'll focus on\nmultitasking during our next lesson.
Thank you, Cleo. But I'm still responsible,\nso I'm going to eat this charred brick of\nfood as punishment!
Right now the walls of my empty belly are\nclangin' together, which is the best\nspice of all! Gimme! *chomp*
Heh. It seems there's no need to worry,\nBotan; we've got someone more than\nhappy to eat up your mistakes.
